intro: Anemopaegma bifarium, commonly known as the two-lobed anemopaegma, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
